content.question:
The figure includes two rays forming an angle and a dashed vertical line segment. There is a note that the figure is not drawn to scale.

One ray is horizontal, pointing to the right. The ray is labeled Jody x mph.

The second ray has the same starting point as the first ray. The two rays form the angle labeled with a measure of pi over 6. The second ray has the label Charlotte 4 mph.

A vertical dashed segment is shown, extending from the horizontal ray to the second ray above it.

The intersection of the dashed segment and the horizontal ray is labeled as a right angle.

The figure shows that Charlotte and Jody are jogging from a common starting point such that the angle formed by their straight paths is <math alttext="pi over 6"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> radians. Charlotte is jogging at <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> miles per hour, and Jody is jogging at <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> miles per hour. Jody’s rate is such that a perpendicular drawn from Jody’s position on her path always intersects Charlotte’s position. What is the value of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 cos open parentheses pi over 6 close parentheses"><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="4 sin open parentheses pi over 6 close parentheses"><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="cos open parentheses pi over 6 close parentheses"><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="sin open parentheses pi over 6 close parentheses"><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 cos open parentheses pi over 6 close parentheses"><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>
